name: Ace of Pentacles
description: A hand emerges from a cloud offering a golden pentacle above a lush garden, symbolizing new beginnings in wealth and the promise of material growth.

name: Ace of Pentacles Reversed
description: The pentacle slips from the hand, falling toward barren ground, representing missed chances or poor foundations in financial or practical matters.

name: Two of Pentacles
description: A juggler dances while keeping two pentacles in motion, bound by an infinite loop, symbolizing balance amid life's changing tides.

name: Two of Pentacles Reversed
description: The juggler loses rhythm as the pentacles fall, symbolizing imbalance, poor time management, or struggles to adapt to shifting priorities.

name: Three of Pentacles
description: A craftsman presents his work in a cathedral, symbolizing mastery through collaboration, planning, and dedication to quality.

name: Three of Pentacles Reversed
description: The cathedral plans falter and voices clash, symbolizing disharmony, lack of effort, or unrecognized skill.

name: Four of Pentacles
description: A crowned figure sits holding a pentacle tightly over the heart, symbolizing stability, attachment to wealth, and fear of loss.

name: Four of Pentacles Reversed
description: The pentacle slips from the figureâ€™s grasp, symbolizing release from control or the collapse of material security.

name: Five of Pentacles
description: Two figures pass a lit church window in the snow, symbolizing material and emotional hardship, yet also hope nearby if sought.

name: Five of Pentacles Reversed
description: The light from the church beckons the weary inward, symbolizing recovery from loss, renewed faith, and gradual restoration.

name: Six of Pentacles
description: A wealthy man weighs coins and offers them to beggars, symbolizing giving, fairness, and the balance between receiving and providing.

name: Six of Pentacles Reversed
description: The scales tilt unevenly as one hand takes more than it gives, symbolizing imbalance, greed, or manipulation in generosity.

name: Seven of Pentacles
description: A farmer rests on his staff, gazing at growing pentacles, symbolizing reflection on progress, investment, and steady cultivation.

name: Seven of Pentacles Reversed
description: The farmer grows weary and the fruit droops, symbolizing frustration, poor returns, or short-sighted choices.

name: Eight of Pentacles
description: An artisan carves pentacles into stone, symbolizing focus, discipline, and learning through repeated effort.

name: Eight of Pentacles Reversed
description: The artisanâ€™s tools are neglected, symbolizing apathy, shortcuts, or lack of commitment to oneâ€™s craft.

name: Nine of Pentacles
description: A woman in fine robes stands in her vineyard with a falcon, symbolizing wealth earned through refinement, discipline, and self-reliance.

name: Nine of Pentacles Reversed
description: The falcon flies off as grapes wither, symbolizing instability, poor decisions, or loss of independence.

name: Ten of Pentacles
description: A family gathers under an archway filled with symbols of prosperity, representing stability, heritage, and enduring success.

name: Ten of Pentacles Reversed
description: The archway crumbles and coins scatter, symbolizing disrupted security, familial tension, or shifting foundations.

name: Page of Pentacles
description: A youthful figure studies a pentacle in an open field, symbolizing curiosity, diligence, and the early stages of skill-building.

name: Page of Pentacles Reversed
description: The student drops the pentacle and looks away, symbolizing neglect of potential or a lack of follow-through.

name: Knight of Pentacles
description: A steadfast knight sits on a still horse, symbolizing loyalty, patience, and consistent effort toward tangible goals.

name: Knight of Pentacles Reversed
description: The knightâ€™s horse stands idle in barren soil, symbolizing stagnation, stubbornness, or dull repetition.

name: Queen of Pentacles
description: A serene queen gazes at a golden pentacle in a lush garden, symbolizing grounded care, domestic wisdom, and material well-being.

name: Queen of Pentacles Reversed
description: The queen turns from her garden, symbolizing misplaced priorities, financial stress, or emotional detachment.

name: King of Pentacles
description: A regal king sits on a throne adorned with vines and bulls, symbolizing mastery of the material world and secure accomplishment.

name: King of Pentacles Reversed
description: The throne darkens and coins tarnish, symbolizing misuse of power, stubbornness, or financial overreach.
